results.title: A Bay in the balance
results.brief_description: In 1972, the Victorian Government responded to a conservation campaign and further industrial development in Westernport was halted. A major scientific study was initiated to examine how the relatively undeveloped bay functions and what future plans should be.
results.description: In 1972, the Victorian Government responded to a conservation campaign and further industrial development in Westernport was halted. A major scientific study was initiated to examine how the relatively undeveloped bay functions and what future plans should be.

results.title: Self construct
results.brief_description:
“Self Construct” explores the personal feelings of a young woman grappling with notions of self identity. The work explores complex ideas of exteranl /internal constructions of “self”. She asks the question - Where does ones identity come from?

Fontaine uses a cut up graphic style to to reflect her sense of dislocation and alienation from others.

Perceptions of memory and thought, interpretation and meaning, are all ideas explored in this innovative and thoughtful work.

“Self Construct” was awarded The Managesoft Award for “Best Final Year Interactive Project ” in the Victoria University BA multimedia course in 2001.

“Self Construct” is also a finalist in the Mayne Award for Multimedia Adelaide Festival Awards for Literature.

results.title: The Hiding place
results.brief_description:
‘The Hiding place’ makes frightening Freudian references to Enid Blyton’s children’s story ‘The Magic faraway tree’. ‘The Hiding place’ examines the fraught relationship between siblings and their mother.

‘The Hiding place’s‘ use of Flash animation and faraway tree theme lulls the viewer into a comfort zone that quickly evaporates as the viewer explores the work. The work features advanced use of net based interactivity.

results.title: MacBeth: a tragedy
results.brief_description:
Double, double, toil and trouble;
Macbeth’s re-born and here come’s trouble!
You’ll see the world through his own eyes,
You’ll meet his horse,
You’ll laugh, you’ll cry.
And somewhere along the way,
I hope that you’ll enjoy this play!

Welcome to the 21st Century where anything is possible as the past collides with the present and Macbeth finds himself resurrected at the Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras. In this interactive comic satire of William Shakespeare’s Macbeth, you must help Macbeth on his adventurous journey as he attempts to find his horse. Will
Macbeth succeed in his quest? It’s up to you to find out!

After experiencing the magical world of the Mardi Gras, learn the art of insults by playing the Shakespearean Insults Quiz. Are you an ‘idol of idiot worshippers’ or will you be successful in solving the quiz and apprehending the Bard? Try this quiz and see for yourself!
